metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1678 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
objects.cc in Google V8 before 5.0.71.32, as used in Google Chrome before51.0.2704.63, does not properly restrict lazy deoptimization, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow)or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1678` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.15.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.15.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
